meta_description: The Walter Anderson Museum of Art (WAMA) is an art museum in Ocean Springs, Mississippi. WAMA celebrates the work of American master Walter Inglis Anderson (1903-1965). The Museum's mission is to empower lifelong curiosty and connection to the natural world through the art of Walter Anderson and kindred artists.
hours_text:
## EXPERIENCE  
WAMA

## PLAN YOUR VISIT TODAY!

For more than three decades, the Walter Anderson Museum of Art has delighted and empowered visitors through the works of Walter Inglis Anderson and kindred artists. The Museum is located in downtown Ocean Springs, just blocks away from the Mississippi Sound, where we interpret and champion coastal culture and the Southern landscape.

## WANT TO MAKE THE MOST OUT OF YOUR VISIT?

## TOURS

Anderson’s story is woven together through his artwork as guides lead close observations and pointed conversations on various artworks, empowering individuals into moments of self-discovery and contemplation through their own understanding.

[BOOK A TOUR](https://www.walterandersonmuseum.org/tours)

## ON VIEW

Discover rotating exhibitions, visiting artist showcases, and permanent installations celebrating Walter Anderson’s legacy and the vibrant creativity of the Gulf Coast.

[LEARN MORE](https://www.walterandersonmuseum.org/exhibitions)

## STAY

Relax at WAMA’s Nest Airbnb or enjoy exclusive rates with our preferred hotel partner, Rain Travel Collection.

[LEARN MORE](https://www.walterandersonmuseum.org/stay)

## RENTALS

Host a variety of celebrations at the Community Center, The Traveler, or museum spaces for a one-of-a-kind artistic backdrop.

[LEARN MORE](https://www.walterandersonmuseum.org/rentals)

collections_text:
[LEARN MORE](https://www.walterandersonmuseum.org/golfcart)

Looking for events, classes, and camps that inspire discovery, imagination, and community building?

[EVENTS ](https://www.walterandersonmuseum.org/events)

Dusti Bongé, a leading modernist painter of the 20th century from Biloxi, Mississippi, evolved her style significantly over the decades. The exhibition at the Walter Anderson Museum of Art showcases her early work from the 1930s and traces her powerful artistic journey rooted in the Gulf South.

[ON VIEW ](https://www.walterandersonmuseum.org/whereseameetssky)
